headline: Six Nations backer courts investors as it kicks off €2.7bn debt deal
summary: The investment vehicle set up to house a string of prominent sports assets is launching a €2.7bn (£2.3bn) debt-raising process aimed at funding its ambitions to become a global powerhouse.  Sky News has learnt that Global Sport Group (GSG), which is owned by CVC Capital Partners and counts a stake in Six Nations Rugby among its holdings, kicked off formal talks with investors on Monday.  The debt deal would provide significant firepower for CVC to acquire other sports properties around the world as it seeks to assemble the globe's most compelling portfolio of sports-related assets.
